author: John Jurgensen
title: How Donald Glover’s ‘Atlanta’ Breaks TV’s Rules
text:
The FX series “Atlanta” is billed as the story of an Ivy League dropout trying to manage his cousin’s music career. But it breaks conventions right and left, veering into surreal asides, abrupt violence and subplots in ways no one expected from a half-hour television comedy.
In its second season, ending on Thursday, it devoted entire episodes to a middle-school flashback and a disastrous trip to a barber. Some episodes didn’t even feature “Atlanta” creator and star Donald Glover, including one in which his cousin, played...
